headline: Stock Market Today, Jan. 27: American Airlines Drops on Q4 Miss and Storm Impact
summary: On Jan. 27, 2026, investors weighed a profit miss, a shutdown, and storm hits against fresh long-term earnings guidance and analyst upgrades.

headline: American Airlines Flight Cancellations Persist as Rivals Move Past Winter Storm
summary: Airlines have largely recovered from winter storm Fern’s snow and ice, but American Airlines continues to struggle.  As of midafternoon, more than 950 American flights scheduled for Tuesday have been scrapped.  Regional carrier PSA Airlines, which operates American-branded flights, has shed over a quarter of its schedule.

raw.headline: American Airlines Flight Cancellations Persist as Rivals Move Past Winter Storm
raw.summary: Airlines have largely recovered from winter storm Fern’s snow and ice, but American Airlines continues to struggle. headline: American Airlines Misses on Q4 Earnings & Revenues, Expects Loss in Q1
summary: AAL posts weak fourth-quarter results with earnings and revenue misses, and warns of a first-quarter loss amid winter storms and rising costs.

headline: American Airlines, JetBlue Shares Are Dropping After Earnings
summary: American Airlines  stock slid early Tuesday as the carrier’s fourth-quarter earnings fell short of expectations but management provided upbeat guidance for 2026.  The carrier reported adjusted earnings per share of 16 cents from revenue of $14 billion.  Wall Street was looking for earnings of 37 cents per share, while revenue was in line with expectations.

headline: Wheels Up Introduces a Seamless, Concierge-Level Customer Engagement Model Under a Single Brand
summary: Wheels Up Experience Inc. (NYSE: UP), a leading provider of on-demand private aviation, today launched a seamless, concierge-level customer engagement model that will deliver individualized, portfolio-wide travel solutions for any trip, from anywhere, to any destination in the world.
